weather_report:
After a lucid, blue afternoon, Swanbourne has slipped into a glassy, clear night. Skies stayed open from mid-afternoon into early evening, so the sun had free run while it lasted, though at this time of year its bite is gentle and the UV low; now, with darkness settled, it’s all cool air and sharp stars. Expect the rest of the evening to remain dry and serene, with excellent clarity and a pleasant hush that makes every footstep sound precise.

Dress for the chill: a warm coat, layers, perhaps a scarf for the walk back from the station or the dog’s last loop. It’s good weather for small, practical things—taking the long way to the shop, checking the car, a quiet saunter to clear the head, or a brief look up to find Orion staking his claim over the rooftops—then home to something warm. If you were out earlier, sunglasses would have been more useful than you’d expect in late autumn; now, it’s simply clear, calm and kind to anyone who likes their evening uncomplicated.
